pr_title: CB-8147. Make node specific metadata (hostGroup, YARN NM attributes)

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think Node should contain this attributes map. It's used only to create a pillar. The main purpose of this class is to pass these data to SaltBootstrap installed on the instances to configure them.
Instead of adding this info to the node you could calculate it when it's need in ClusterHostServiceRunner
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: Will look into this as an option.
replies.author: sidseth

timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText: I don't like using Java streams (not as easy to read). If that's the pattern that is generally used, I can switch it over. (Applies to other comments related to streams)

replies.bodyText: Think this is very specific to CB code style? I think comments in the code can be quite helpful.

replies.bodyText:
comments tends to be outdated, misleading. Usually indicates the code is not "clean", doesn't speak for itself which could be improved by refactoring, like breaking into methods with good names, etc
We generally avoid them as much as possible and leave comments where it's really necessary.

replies.bodyText: Goign to modify this comment a bit. It is relevant in the sense that determining a node as 'compute' means that it can be AutoScaled, and so it is important to re-use the autoscale recommendation logic.

timeline.message:
CB-8147. Make node specific metadata (hostGroup, YARN NM attributes)
available on cluster nodes.

- New metadata file created under /opt/metadata/node.json on cluster
nodes, which contains the hostGroup name, and service specific
attributes.
- The service specific attributes introduced in this PR are for YARN,
and specify whether a node is a compute or worker based on the services
running on the node (instead of relying on the hostGroup name).

timeline.bodyText:
I think this should be moved to a separate class together with getAttributesForHostGroup.
And this method should return with a map, like:
Map.of("hostattrs", new SaltPillarProperties("/nodes/hostattrs.sls", singletonMap("hostattrs", attributes)))
And in line 303 you would need only:
servicePillar.putAll(createHostAttributes(..));
I know there is a lot of code here (even written by me) where we add stuff to this map by passing it around but honestly it's not the best solution.
Moving this method out would make @VisibleForTesting unnecessary which is already a sign that it should be in a separate class.
timeline.author: lacikaaa

replies.bodyText:
Moving this into a HostAttributeDecorator, and having that set the PillarProperties instead of returning a map.
I'm going to ask you to make changes to return a map if you feel strongly about that / other code style changes. Given I don't write a lot of CB patches - was avoiding any kind of re-structuring and following existing patterns as much as possible.
replies.author: sidseth
